name: Opera Bookmarks File
summary: Learn about .ADR files and view a list of programs that open them.

windows.name: Open over 400 file formats with File Viewer Plus.Free Download

content: NOTE: Only versions of Opera using the Presto engine support ADR files. In 2013, Opera moved to Chromium, ending support for ADR files.

description: An ADR file (saved with .adr extension) is a list of bookmarks created by the Opera Web browser. This list gets populated as user keeps bookmarking web URLs. These bookmarks are stored in the ADR file that can be backed up and restored when required. Since most browsers such as Chrome and Firefox save bookmarks in HTML format, these can be converted to ADR file format for importing in Opera browser. ADR files can be opened in Opera browser.

An ADR file contains a list of saved bookmarks created by version 12 or earlier of the Opera web browser. It stores URL links to websites users have chosen to save for quick access later, including the website address and the title displayed in the browser. ADR files allow users to export and import their bookmarks to transfer favorite sites between different devices or Opera installations or back them up.

instructions: You can open ADR files with the Opera web browser. However, it must be version 12 or earlier.

You can convert an ADR file to an .HTML file with Opera (version 12 and earlier) by importing the ADR file, and then exporting it as an HTML bookmark. This option is helpful if you are looking to import bookmarks from old versions of Opera into a newer version.
